name: Breach Notification Rule
description: Requires covered entities and business associates to notify individuals, media, and HHS of breaches of unsecured PHI. Establishes timeline, content, and method of notification requirements.

name: Breach Definition
description: Unauthorized acquisition, access, use, or disclosure of PHI that compromises security or privacy. Excludes unintentional access by authorized persons and inadvertent disclosures to other authorized users.

name: Risk Assessment - Harm to Individual
description: Analysis to determine if a breach poses significant risk of harm to individual. Four-factor test: type/amount of PHI, unauthorized person, safeguards in place, mitigation efforts.

name: Risk Assessment Process
description: Systematic process to evaluate breach severity. Factors: nature/extent of PHI involved, who accessed/disclosed, degree of risk, whether PHI actually acquired/accessed.

name: Individual Notification
description: Covered entities must notify affected individuals without unreasonable delay (no later than 60 calendar days after breach discovery). Notification must include: breach description, types of PHI involved, steps taken, and mitigation steps.

name: Media Notification
description: For breaches affecting 500+ residents in jurisdiction, covered entities must notify prominent media outlets without unreasonable delay. Media must be notified at same time as individuals.

name: HHS Notification
description: Covered entities must notify Secretary of HHS. For breaches of 500+ residents, notice to HHS must include name, postal address, and telephone number of media contacted.

name: Business Associate Notification
description: Business associates must notify covered entities without unreasonable delay upon discovery of breach. Timing: without unreasonable delay, but specifics depend on contract terms.

name: Email Notification
description: Notification by email if covered entity has email address on file. Must be sent in manner that does not further compromise security of PHI.

name: Certified Mail
description: Notification by first-class mail, or other reasonable and appropriate means. May substitute email if individual has agreed to electronic notification.

name: Telephone Notification
description: Notification by telephone. Appropriate when email/mail contact information is not available or individual cannot be reached by other means.

name: Public Notice
description: When contact information unavailable or unreliable, covered entity must take steps reasonably calculated to give notice. Public notice in prominent media or by postal service notice.

name: Breach Description
description: Notification must describe: nature and scope of breach, types of PHI involved, steps taken by entity, and steps individuals can take.

name: Mitigation Steps
description: Notification must include mitigation steps available to individuals, such as credit monitoring, identity theft protection, and fraud alerts.

name: Contact Information
description: Notification must include covered entity contact information: phone number where individuals can call with questions, toll-free call center, or website.

name: 60-Day Individual Notification
description: Individuals must be notified without unreasonable delay and in no case later than 60 calendar days after discovery of breach.

name: Breach Discovery
description: 'Discovery' means the date entity knew or reasonably should have known breach occurred. Includes moment of unauthorized access, or reasonable cause to know breach occurred.

name: Concurrent Media HHS Notification
description: Media and HHS must be notified at same time as individuals or without unreasonable delay. Cannot delay HHS notification.

name: Low Probability of Compromise Exception
description: No notification required if covered entity demonstrates low probability that PHI has been compromised. Must conduct risk assessment to determine if further notification is required.

name: OCR Enforcement
description: HHS Office for Civil Rights enforces Breach Notification Rule. Investigates complaints, conducts audits, and assesses civil penalties for violations.

name: State Attorney General Enforcement
description: State Attorneys General have authority to enforce Breach Notification Rule on behalf of residents. Can investigate and pursue civil remedies.
